Hi, I'd like to propose a controversial topic, which is to somehow split
up=
 the JUnit email list into two lists - one for beginners and one for
interm=
ediate-to-advanced users.  I cherish the discussion on this list
about meat=
y topics of unit testing and using and extending JUnit.  There
are some ver=
y smart people here!

However, I frankly have reached the limit of my toler=
ance for stupid
questions in this list.  And by "stupid questions" I mean t=
he opposite
of Eric Raymond's "smart questions"
(http://www.catb.org/~esr/f=
aqs/smart-questions.html).  There seems to be
no end to the steady stream o=
f new members who sign on and immediately
ask a question that's already ans=
wered in the JUnit FAQ, which every new
member automatically receives.  I k=
now hitting the delete key 5 or 10
times a day isn't a huge deal, so I gues=
s it's just the principle of it
all.  I consider it rude for people to not =
have the courtesy to at least
make an effort to help themselves.

But I tho=
ught that rather than just unsubscribing from the list, I'd
toss this messa=
ge out to see if anyone else is in the same boat as me.
There are supposedl=
y over 6000 subscribers, which sure sounds like a big
enough population to =
allow some specialization.  Alternatively, if
dividing the junit@yahoogroup=
s.com list isn't likely to happen, does
anyone know of a similar forum for =
"intermediate-to-advanced" users of
JUnit with a better S/N ratio?


Thanks=
 for listening,
Todd.
